title: Designing Digital-Based Inclusive Science Inquiry Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Basic scientific knowledge (experiment design, data analysis), online learning tool usage experience, and comprehension of the scientific inquiry process
context.additional_context: For graduate students, implementing instructional design scenarios combining digital transformation trends in science with inclusive learning environment design: enhancing accessibility of experimental materials considering diverse learning backgrounds, optimizing digital-face-to-face integrated inquiry activities.

learning_goals: Ability to design and execute science inquiry content applying the flipped learning model, emphasizing the scientific inquiry process: hypothesis formulation, variable control, and experimental data analysis.

Develop a collaborative science experiment scenario based on the FLeD tool to improve learner engagement by over 30%: integrating observation recording sharing, evidence-based discussion, and conclusion-drawing activities

Graduate students can design one hybrid learning strategy integrating digital environments (Google Classroom, Zoom, etc.) and in-person lab classes, and establish an action plan demonstrating over 80% achievement in at least two of three predefined evaluation criteria (participation, learning effectiveness, technology utilization): including experimental design collaboration, data visualization, and scientific argumentation assessment

resources: Digital Content Templates for Science Subjects

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
